entry.title: Re: Public Cloud Payment medium file - Hash total calcula...
entry.content:
Hello @Sandhya_Reddy1 

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, the supplied Payment Medium Formats and the mapping logic in the Manage Payment Medium Formats app do not permit the direct embedding of multistep custom hash algorithms for .txt outputs, especially when they involve multi-field calculations like in your 3-step example.

You have a few possible approaches:

Pre/Post-Processing with Payment Medium Workbench (PMW)

  • If your format is PMW-based, you can use mapping logic extensions via Custom Fields and Logic (BAdI FINS_PMT_MEDIUM_MAP).
  • However, for .txt output, PMW still generates the file in the standard sequence, you need to include your calculated hash as part of a footer or trailer record.

SAP Help ‚Äì configure Payment Medium Formats
SAP Help ‚Äì BAdI for Payment Medium Mapping

Side-by-Side Calculation in BTP

  • Send the payment data to SAP Business Technology Platform via an API (API_PAYMENTADVICE_SRV or API_OUTBOUND_PAYMENTS_SRV), perform the hash total logic in a small Node.js/Java service, and output the .txt file in the exact format the bank needs.
  • This gives full control over calculations but keeps the Public Cloud core clean.


SAP API Business Hub ‚Äì Outbound Payments API

Use Advanced Payment Management (if licensed)

  • If your landscape includes SAP Advanced Payment Management on BTP, you can establish file creation logic with custom calculations prior to generating the bank file.

In brief,

  • Public Cloud itself cannot incorporate this kind of multi-step hashing logic directly for .txt formats through standard configuration.
  • The most practical options are BAdI-based mapping logic in PMW or side-by-side processing in BTP.
  • The blog you found applies to .xml naming/hash rules and doesn‚Äôt cover .txt line-hash scenarios.

If you would like, I can prepare a BAdI sample implementation that performs your exact 3-step calculation so you can integrate it into the Payment Medium Mapping for .txt formats.

Let me know if you need further information

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: manage purchase order workflow in inapproval status
entry.content:
Hello @jerrysam 

The status displayed in the Manage Purchase Orders Fiori app is the definitive status for subsequent activities like Goods Receipt (GR).

If the PO still shows In Approval in this app, GR posting will be blocked even if other views appear to show released. This usually happens when the Flexible Workflow encounters an error or is interrupted during processing.

Steps to resolve it,

  • Open the Workflows in the Status Error app (requires the administrator role SAP_BR_ADMINISTRATOR or equivalent).
  • Locate the affected PO and select Resume After Error.
    • This continues the approval without restarting the workflow.
  • Check the Manage Purchase Orders app to confirm the status is now released.
  • Once the status is updated, you can post the GR.
  • If the status does not change or the PO does not appear in Workflows in Status Error, please raise an SAP support ticket under component MM-FIO-PUR-PO-WFL.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: SEN: Tags for email notifications to users
entry.content:
Hi Charlene,

There are two ways to send messages to Enable Now users.

1. In the Manager > Server Settings area there is a Notifications and Email section of settings that provides the ability to send message to content authors and administrators when specific activities are triggered, e.g. to send a message to an author to trigger an update to that object.  The Activation setting in this area can be used to send messages to new end users to inform them their manual user account has been created.  So, this option will not help with your requirement

2. The second option is to use the messaging system in Manager to send messages to end users - Administration > Messages.  In this case, it is possible to use this functionality to send formatted messages to end users.  There is no way to embed placeholders into the Body of the message, e.g. to insert content such as a Course Title, but the content in the message can be formatted using HTML tags. 
The To field of the message will allow you to target specific users for your message, typically using a User Role or Org Unit value.

This is definitely your best option to target Enable Now user groups with email messages.

Regards
Shane

entry.title: Re: How to integrate SAP GRDC with Datasphere for public...
entry.content:
Hello @897654208074 

You can integrate SAP Group Reporting Data Collection (GRDC) with SAP Datasphere using the OData APIs that GRDC provides.

High-level steps below.

  • Find the right GRDC API in SAP API Business Hub (e.g., API_CNSLDTNGRPJRNLENTRT for consolidation journal entries).
  • Create a Communication User, System, and Arrangement in S/4HANA Cloud for that API (e.g., scenario SAP_COM_0524).
  • In SAP Datasphere, create a connection to S/4HANA Cloud using the API host and Basic Authentication from your Communication User.
  • Browse and import the OData entities into Datasphere as Remote Tables.
  • Model and consume the data for reporting.

Check below documentation

  • SAP Help ‚Äì Connect SAP Datasphere to S/4HANA Cloud
  • Learning HUB
  • SAP Help ‚Äì Group Reporting Data Collection Overview

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Process for migrating in learning history
entry.content:
Hello Sarah,

Please find below some discussion I could think of in terms of migration process for learning-related records.

Learning History
We normally recommend customers migrate their learning history from legacy to SF LMS where it will make sense after go-live. By "make sense", it can be part of the onboarding, compliance, or legal required courses, or it can be driving retraining. The rest of history can be maintained offline with the learning admin, or available online through SharePoint/Drive etc, and attach the link somewhere in SF / LMS so that it is accessible by the users. The reason for bringing in data that "makes sense" is that, as you mentioned, these learning history records need to be held against an item. So more history = more items to be migrated, and more values to be populated in the "reference" template.

Learning Items
In terms of learning items, we general do not recommend segregating the legacy items vs items to be used after golive, as it may confuse users. But if for reporting purposes, each single version of the items need to be tracked and reported on, then legacy items with versions will need to be imported with a shell, to host the learning history.

Otherwise the ideal scenario will be only migrate items that will be utilised after golive, and migrate the history for these items. Then no substitution relationship needs to be maintained as part of the data migration process. Given the history will be mapped directly against these items.

Completion Status for Migration?
We generally do not do anything special for migration, including completion statuses. As these statuses will not be used after golive, and it will be sort of redundant and just for one purpose. Customer's learning admins I worked with have never asked for another completion status, as the completion date and time was enough to tell. However, we do maintain substitution completion status just in case customers will use this function in the future.

Summing up we suggest customers to plan things around what is needed post go-live, and minimise the migration data where possible. But the process would change based on specific customer requirements, including notifications, assignments etc. Please feel free to post any further questions if the above does not suffice.

Thanks,
Sunny

entry.title: Re: Call an OData Web API Service externally
entry.content:
Thanks everone, based on input from everyone here, I have written the python code which connects to BTP and get the data from OData Web API. Here are the information, please note I made subtle changes to protect privacy, so URL and secrets are not going to work.

 

Data in your .env file:

SAP_TOKEN_URL =  

https://66a8b6c0trial.authentication.us10.hana.ondemand.com/oauth/token [note there is no -web part]
 
SAP_ODATA_URL=https://7ab63f61-d9a7-4bdf-9057-beead39881c1.abap.us10.hana.ondemand.com/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZAPI_FLIGHT_WS_V2
SAP_USERNAME=[User Id you use to login to BTP Cockpit]
SAP_PASSWORD=[this is password you used to long into BTP Cockpit]
SAP_CLIENT_ID=sb-e773505a-dacd-3345-a599-3f65e3af3ccb!b484036|abap-trial-service-broker!b3132
SAP_CLIENT_SECRET=7ab91380-1422-4677-b5c7-437465cca37f$mOFnxea8Gvos2v03I2SBKZWqgHy2Q5K2hp6QnRrtGq8=
SAP_SCOPE= 
 
 
 
import requests
import json
import os
from dotenv import load_dotenv
from pathlib import Path

# Load environment variables from a .env file
env_path = Path('.') / '.env'  # Adjust path if needed
load_dotenv(dotenv_path=env_path)

# Debug: Print environment variables to verify they are loaded
print("SAP_TOKEN_URL:", os.getenv("SAP_TOKEN_URL"))
print("SAP_CLIENT_ID:", os.getenv("SAP_CLIENT_ID"))
print("SAP_CLIENT_SECRET:", os.getenv("SAP_CLIENT_SECRET"))
print("SAP_SCOPE:", os.getenv("SAP_SCOPE"))
print("SAP_USERNAME:", os.getenv("SAP_USERNAME"))  # For Password Credentials
print("SAP_PASSWORD:", "****" if os.getenv("SAP_PASSWORD") else None)  # Masked for security

def fetch_sap_odata():
    token_url = os.getenv("SAP_TOKEN_URL")
    client_id = os.getenv("SAP_CLIENT_ID")
    client_secret = os.getenv("SAP_CLIENT_SECRET")
    scope = os.getenv("SAP_SCOPE")
    username = os.getenv("SAP_USERNAME")
    password = os.getenv("SAP_PASSWORD")

    # Check if required environment variables are set
    if not all([token_url, client_id, client_secret, username, password]):
        raise ValueError("Missing required environment variables: SAP_TOKEN_URL, SAP_CLIENT_ID, SAP_CLIENT_SECRET, SAP_USERNAME, or SAP_PASSWORD")

    # Step 1: Fetch OAuth token
    url = token_url
    data = {
        "grant_type": "password",
        "username": username,
        "password": password,
        "client_id": client_id,
        "client_secret": client_secret
    }
    
    if scope:
        data["scope"] = scope

    headers = {
        "Content-Type": "application/x-www-form-urlencoded"
    }
    
    try:
        session = requests.Session()
        response = session.post(url, data=data, headers=headers)
        response.raise_for_status()
        token_data = response.json()
        access_token = token_data.get("access_token")
        if not access_token:
            raise ValueError("No access token received from token endpoint")
        print("Token response:", token_data)
    except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e:
        print(f"Error fetching token: {e}")
        return

    # Step 2: OData API call to ZI_Connection_WS
    odata_base_url = os.getenv("SAP_ODATA_URL")
    if not odata_base_url:
        raise ValueError("Missing SAP_ODATA_URL environment variable")
    
    odata_url = f"{odata_base_url}/ZI_Connection_WS"
    headers = {
        "Authorization": f"Bearer {access_token}",
        "Accept": "application/json",
        "Content-Type": "application/json"
    }

    try:
        response = requests.get(odata_url, headers=headers)
        print("Code:", response.status_code)
        print("Server response:", response.text)

        if response.status_code == 200:
            try:
                print("ZI_Connection_WS data:", json.dumps(response.json(), indent=2))
            except requests.exceptions.JSONDecodeError:
                print("‚ùå Error: No JSON response.")
        else:
            print("‚ùå Error response:", response.status_code, response.text)
    except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e:
        print(f"Error fetching ZI_Connection_WS data: {e}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    fetch_sap_odata()

entry.title: MT940 files requires selecting both a specific company and bank account
entry.content:
Dear SAP,

We want to know the functionality of MT940

In SAP Business ByDesign, the current manual import process for MT940 files requires selecting both a specific company and bank account, which implies that the MT940 files must be separated by account prior to upload.

At present, our customers are receiving consolidated MT940 files that include transactions from multiple bank accounts. We would like to know if it is possible to upload such multi-account MT940 files without having to specify the company and bank account during the upload process.

Please let me know if there is option available for above requirement.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: MT940 files requires selecting both a specific compan...
entry.content:
Dear Customer, 

When importing MT940 files in Liquidity Management > File Management > Inbound Files, it is necessary to select both:

  • Company

  • Bank ID (House Bank)

A Bank ID in ByDesign can represent a house bank that may contain one or more individual bank accounts. However, the MT940 format also includes an account identification field (tag :25:), and the system expects the transactions in the uploaded file to match the specific account linked to the Bank ID selection.

Even if a Bank ID contains multiple accounts, the file uploaded must contain transactions for only one account. The system will not automatically detect and split transactions for different accounts within the same Bank ID.

At present, splitting the file before upload remains the only available option to ensure correct assignment of transactions in SAP Business ByDesign.

 

Hope this clarify your question. 

 

Best regards,  
Ihan
SAP Technical Support

entry.title: Managing Exceptions in Sales Material Exclusions in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
Scenario: As a Sales Representative, you want to ensure that certain products cannot be sold to specific customers. These customers belong to a customer hierarchy. However, there may be exceptions where a specific customer within the hierarchy is allowed to purchase the product.

Example: All customers under the hierarchy node North cannot purchase the product TG11. However, the customer DEMO_C02, under the same node, is allowed to purchase TG11.

Configuration steps

1. Create Condition Types:

Create a new condition type Z002 for the "excluded list" using the pre-delivered access sequence A001.

Create another condition type Z003 using the pre-delivered customer hierarchy access sequence A003.

2. Implement Cloud BADI:

Create a Cloud BADI implementation YY1_EXCLUDELIST with the extension ID SD_LSTG_EXCLSN_RQMT_DOC_ITEM in the App ‚ÄòCustomer Logic‚Äô.

Write logic to ensure that records maintained in condition type Z002 can override the exclusion records. Condition records for listing exclusion can be retrieved via released CDS view I_SlsMatlLstgOrExclsnRecord.

3. Create a requirement 3000000 with the task SD_LSTG_EXCLSN_RQMT_DOC_ITEM. Assign the Cloud BAdI implementation YY1_EXCLUDELIST to this requirement.

4. Assign the requirement 3000000 to the listing/exclusion procedure Z003.

5. Assign the procedure Z003 to the exclusion process for sales orders (e.g., OR).

6. Use the App ‚ÄòCreate Material Listings and Exclusions‚Äô to create new records:

Excluded list for specific customers.

Records for customer hierarchy.

Test the Configuration:

Scenario 1:

Create a sales order with the customer DEMO_C01 and material TG11.

Result: Product TG11 is excluded for customer DEMO_C01 because this customer belongs to the North hierarchy node, which excludes TG11.

Scenario 2:

Create a sales order with the customer DEMO_C02 and material TG11.

Result: Product TG11 is allowed for customer DEMO_C02 because it matches the "Exclude list" condition in condition type Z002, even though it also belongs to the North hierarchy node.

entry.title: Re: SEN: Tags for email notifications to users
entry.content:
Hi Charlene,

SAP Companion contains 4 different tabs of information, the What's New tab is one of the four.  The reason that I mention that tab is because it proactively notifies users of new content.  But, it will not distinguish between users groups.

One of the other tabs in SAP Companion, the Learning tab, provides access to Enable Now content, such as new courseware and Simulations.  It is possible to control what content appears in that tab based on Business Roles, which can be used to target a group of users with a specific block of content.  Unfortunately, the content in the Learning tab does not proactively notify users of the existence of the content, users must open the Learning tab on the relevant screen to access the content.

So, given that proactive notification is central to your strategy to drive engagement, your options are:

1. The Messages screen in Manager - you can target specific user groups with these messages
2. The What's New tab in SAP Companion - you cannot target specific user groups with this information, if a user opens the relevant screen in the application they will receive the message
3. One of the other methods of auto showing content using SAP Companion, e.g. auto starting Link Tiles - you cannot target specific user groups with these messages.

Hope that helps.

Regards
Shane

entry.title: Re: FI Doc Types Authorization Group: Examples
entry.content:
An Authorization Group is a way to restrict access to specific objects‚Äîlike tables, programs, vendors, or document types‚Äîbased on user roles. It works in tandem with authorization objects (like S_TABU_DIS for tables or F_LFA1_BEK for vendors).

Think of it like a security tag: only users with the right clearance (via roles) can access objects tagged with a specific authorization group.

An example use case be let‚Äôs say you‚Äôre creating a new document type for confidential purchase orders (e.g., for strategic sourcing). You assign it an Authorization Group called ZSTR. What happens next is only users whose roles include access to ZSTR (via the relevant authorization object) can view or process these POs. Even if someone has general access to purchase orders, they won‚Äôt be able to access those tagged with ZSTR unless their role explicitly allows it. This is especially useful for:

  • Securing sensitive vendor data
  • Restricting access to financial documents
  • Controlling who can run or modify custom reports/programs

To answer your question 'Do we need to provide these values to Developers?', yes if the developer is creating or modifying programs, reports, or custom logic that should be protected by the same authorization group, you should share the value (e.g., ZSTR) with them. Why because, Developers may need to assign the same group to custom programs via SE38. They might need to check for authorization using ABAP logic (AUTHORITY-CHECK). It ensures consistency across all objects tied to that document type.

To create an Authorization Group, go to SE54 and assign groups to tables or views. Use SM30 to maintain entries in table TBRG (central repository of auth groups). Assign the group to the relevant object (e.g., vendor via FK02, customer via XD02, program via SE38).

entry.title: Re: How to define the Revenue attribute in the WBS elemen...
entry.content:
In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, the traditional method of assigning the Revenue attribute to a WBS element‚Äîsuch as using transaction code CJ02‚Äîis not applicable, since GUI-based configuration access is restricted in the public cloud environment. Instead, revenue-related WBS elements are managed through predefined apps and configuration settings.

Key Differences from On-Premise

  • No access to CJ02 or CJ20N: These GUI transactions are not available.
  • Billing elements are not manually selectable in WBS details.
  • Revenue WBS elements are typically automatically created based on project structure and billing setup.

The recommended approach would be

In the Professional Services scenario, WBS elements ending in .0.1 are automatically created as billing elements. These are superior to expense WBS elements like .1.1, .1.2, etc. Revenue is posted to the billing WBS element when customer billing occurs.

To ensure revenue tracking, create separate billing items for each work package. This aligns the expense WBS with the billing WBS in a 1:1 relationship. Use the CDS view I_ENTERPRISEPROJECTELEMENT to verify hierarchy and attributes.

Also have a look at this discussion

entry.title: Re: tax jurisdiction has defective structure,
entry.content:
Some common causes are

Incorrect Structure Format

Each tax jurisdiction code must match the structure defined in the system. For example: Structure: 2,2,5,1 means the code should be split into four levels with lengths 2, 2, 5, and 1 respectively. If your code is VA00234560, it must conform to this format exactly.

Double-check the structure defined in your configuration and ensure all codes match it precisely.

Wrong SSCUI Used

In some cases, users mistakenly enter tax jurisdiction codes in the wrong configuration view. Use SSCUI 102915 ‚Äì Define Tax Jurisdiction Codes instead of manually entering codes in views like V_TTXJ.

Pre-existing Codes Preventing Changes

If tax jurisdiction codes are already created, the system may prevent changes to the structure. You may need to delete and re-create the codes or raise a ticket with SAP support to adjust the structure safely.

Using Internal vs External Tax Procedures

If you're using internal tax procedures like USTAXJ, ensure the structure aligns with the expected format for your region (e.g., ZIP code level for U.S.).

entry.title: Re: Error ME708 when deleting memorized MIRO
entry.content:
SAP Note 2143933 provides a workaround to delete parked or pre-edited supplier invoices that cannot be posted or canceled via standard transactions like MIR4 or MR8M. The note includes a custom report: Z_MRM_DELETE_PP_1.
What this report is supposed to do is that it deletes parked supplier invoice documents that are stuck due to inconsistencies or obsolete prepayment flows. Updates the status from parked to deleted. Targets documents that cannot be processed due to errors like M8_2501 or ME708.

In your case, if it is not working, then, it could be due to

  • authorization restrictions, client-specific data locks, or missing transport of dependent objects.
  • the report may not have updated all relevant tables (e.g., RBKP, RSEG, EKBE) or failed due to missing commit logic.
  • if M8_2501 still appears, then, it indicates that the invoice is still considered active or linked to a PO item that has already been invoiced.

What you can try is again go to se38, run that report with Document number, Fiscal Year and Company Code. Ensure that the status message confirms deletion (not just simulation).
Check in tables like RBKP, RSEG, EKBE and confirm that the invoice document is no longer linked or marked as parked.
If a real invoice was posted against the same PO item, the parked invoice may be blocked from deletion. Use MIR4 to simulate posting and check for conflicts

Still if the issue is not resolved in production, raise a ticket with SAP referencing the above SAP Note 2143933

entry.title: Re: Call an OData Web API Service externally
entry.content:
Code for CSRF for posting

import requests
import json
import os
from dotenv import load_dotenv
from pathlib import Path

# Load environment variables from a .env file
env_path = Path('.') / '.env'  # Adjust path if needed
load_dotenv(dotenv_path=env_path)

# Debug: Print environment variables to verify they are loaded
print("SAP_TOKEN_URL:", os.getenv("SAP_TOKEN_URL"))
print("SAP_CLIENT_ID:", os.getenv("SAP_CLIENT_ID"))
print("SAP_CLIENT_SECRET:", os.getenv("SAP_CLIENT_SECRET"))
print("SAP_SCOPE:", os.getenv("SAP_SCOPE"))
print("SAP_USERNAME:", os.getenv("SAP_USERNAME"))  # For Password Credentials
print("SAP_PASSWORD:", "****" if os.getenv("SAP_PASSWORD") else None)  # Masked for security

def fetch_sap_odata():
    token_url = os.getenv("SAP_TOKEN_URL")
    client_id = os.getenv("SAP_CLIENT_ID")
    client_secret = os.getenv("SAP_CLIENT_SECRET")
    scope = os.getenv("SAP_SCOPE")
    username = os.getenv("SAP_USERNAME")
    password = os.getenv("SAP_PASSWORD")

    # Check if required environment variables are set
    if not all([token_url, client_id, client_secret, username, password]):
        raise ValueError("Missing required environment variables: SAP_TOKEN_URL, SAP_CLIENT_ID, SAP_CLIENT_SECRET, SAP_USERNAME, or SAP_PASSWORD")

    # Step 1: Fetch OAuth token
    url = token_url
    data = {
        "grant_type": "password",
        "username": username,
        "password": password,
        "client_id": client_id,
        "client_secret": client_secret
    }
    
    if scope:
        data["scope"] = scope

    headers = {
        "Content-Type": "application/x-www-form-urlencoded"
    }
    
    try:
        session = requests.Session()
        response = session.post(url, data=data, headers=headers)
        response.raise_for_status()
        token_data = response.json()
        access_token = token_data.get("access_token")
        if not access_token:
            raise ValueError("No access token received from token endpoint")
        print("Token response:", token_data)
    except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e:
        print(f"Error fetching token: {e}")
        return

    # Step 2: Fetch CSRF token
    odata_base_url = os.getenv("SAP_ODATA_URL")
    if not odata_base_url:
        raise ValueError("Missing SAP_ODATA_URL environment variable")
    
    odata_url_csrf = f"{odata_base_url}/ZI_Connection_WS"
    headers = {
        "Authorization": f"Bearer {access_token}",
        "X-CSRF-Token": "Fetch",
        "Accept": "application/json"
    }

    try:
        csrf_response = session.get(url=odata_url_csrf, headers=headers)
        csrf_response.raise_for_status()
        csrf_token = csrf_response.headers.get("X-CSRF-Token")
        if not csrf_token:
            print("Warning: No CSRF token found in response headers.")
        else:
            print("CSRF Token retrieved:", csrf_token)
    except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e:
        print(f"Error fetching CSRF token: {e}")
        return

    # Step 3: OData API call to ZI_Connection_WS
    odata_url = f"{odata_base_url}/ZI_Connection_WS"
    headers = {
        "Authorization": f"Bearer {access_token}",
        "X-CSRF-Token": csrf_token if csrf_token else "",
        "Accept": "application/json",
        "Content-Type": "application/json"
    }

    try:
        response = session.get(odata_url, headers=headers)
        print("Code:", response.status_code)
        print("Server response:", response.text)

        if response.status_code == 200:
            try:
                print("ZI_Connection_WS data:", json.dumps(response.json(), indent=2))
            except requests.exceptions.JSONDecodeError:
                print("‚ùå Error: No JSON response.")
        else:
            print("‚ùå Error response:", response.status_code, response.text)

        # Example: Placeholder for a modifying request (e.g., POST)
        # if csrf_token:
        #     post_data = {"SomeField": "SomeValue"}  # Customize this data
        #     post_response = session.post(odata_url, headers=headers, json=post_data)
        #     print("POST Response Code:", post_response.status_code)
        #     print("POST Response:", post_response.text)
        #     if post_response.status_code == 201:  # 201 Created
        #         print("Data successfully posted.")
        #     else:
        #         print("‚ùå POST failed:", post_response.status_code, post_response.text)

    except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e:
        print(f"Error fetching ZI_Connection_WS data: {e}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    fetch_sap_odata()

entry.title: Re: Delivery address change causes a subsequent leg in sh...
entry.content:
SAP uses leg determination to break down a shipment into stages:

  • Preliminary leg: From shipping point to consolidation point
  • Main leg: From consolidation point to destination region
  • Subsequent leg: From destination region to final delivery point

Changing the Ship-To address can trigger a reclassification of the route, especially if:

  • the new address is in a different region or country
  • the system identifies a need for an additional transport stage

When the Ship-To address is modified, SAP recalculates the route and determines that the new address requires an additional leg. This is common when the new address is outside the original transportation zone

If the shipment type is configured to support multi-leg determination (leg indicator types 2, 3, 4, or 5), the system may automatically insert a subsequent leg to reflect the new logistics path

What you can do is Check leg determination settings in customizing (SPRO > Logistics Execution > Transportation > Shipment > Define Leg Determination). Review the route and transportation zone of the new Ship-To address. If the subsequent leg is not desired, consider adjusting:

  • Shipping conditions
  • Transportation zones
  • Leg determination rules

entry.title: Re: Adobe forms displayed correctly in spool but not corr...
entry.content:
Below are some recommended approaches

  • Use transaction SPAD to inspect and adjust the output device settings. Go to SPAD ‚Üí Output Devices ‚Üí Display, select NL-WET-27, check the Format Type (e.g., DINA4, LETTER), ensure the Left and Right Margins are not too narrow. If needed, create a custom format with wider printable area.
  • Open the form in Adobe LiveCycle Designer and set page margins to allow extra space on left/right. Avoid placing critical content too close to the edges. Consider reducing the page width slightly to accommodate printer limitations.
  • Try printing to a different device (e.g., a generic PDF printer or another physical printer) to isolate whether the issue is with NL-WET-27 specifically.

entry.title: Issue Of Non-stock Item To The Work Order
entry.content:
ISSUING NON-STOCK MATERIAL TO WORK ORDER: -

There is a scenario where the material is not present in the inventory, and it needs to be procured from the external vendor then we will just follow the following steps: -

Work process of issuing non-stock items to work order: -

  1. Work order: - A work order is being created and the necessary details like c
  2. omponents and operations are being entered.
  3. Components tab: - here in the components tab the material description will be entered as the material that needs to be procured from the vendor. And also, the item category here will be entered as ‚ÄòN‚Äô ‚Äì non-stock item.
  4. Purchasing data: - the purchasing data must be entered as we have mentioned non-stock items. The purchasing data like purchasing organization, purchasing group, vendor etc.... some of the necessary details will be entered into in the purchasing data.
  5. Converting the purchase requestion into purchase order: - Purchase requestion (PR) will be raised from the order and the Material Management (MM) team will convert the purchase requestion into purchase order (PO).
  6. Converting the purchase order into goods receipt: - After converting into the purchase order, the goods receipt will be done.
  7. No goods issue needed: - Here the goods issue is not needed. When the goods receipt is being done the materials will directly send to the order not into inventory and here you cannot see the stock in the inventory.
  8. Confirmation & TECO: - Confirmation will be done after doing the maintenance activities and then the TECO.
  9. Settlement: - The settlement is being done by the FICO team at the end of the month.

STEP 1: -

Creation of notification will be done based on the requirement that might be whether malfunction (M2) or else maintenance request (M1). Here for example, we will take the maintenance request (M1) It means a machine needs general maintenance in a plant which is being installed in a functional location .

The functional location & equipment details will be maintained by the person at the machine, and he will save the notification. Then after the production supervisor will get in touch with the person who was responsible of creation of notification

STEP 2: -

The production supervisor will go and inspect the machine which is present at the functional location, and he will set the priority, object parts and all the parameters like the object part, tasks , activity etc....

After entering the details of the object part and priority by the production supervisor the notification will be put in the process by clicking on the green flag which is present in the application toolbar.

If any of the tasks need to be performed as well as the causes, the production supervisor will also add them to the notification, and he will also release the tasks too.

Here we can observe the status of the notification.

STEP 3: -

After that we will just create an order based on notification in the T-code IW34 based on notificaiton creation of order.

Here the work order is being created, and the details of the functional location and all the details of the equipment will be picked up from the notification which wa created earlier step .

Here are the operation details and the calculation key will be given  as well as the no.of persons that are required for maintaining the equipment or machine

then the components are maintained in the components tab where the materials that are needed for maintenance and there is one material which is not present in the invenotry.

All the purchasing data will be maintained by the production supervisor and then after he will save the order.

Purchasing organization: - it is responsible for procuring materials or services etc.‚Ä¶

Supplier: - the person who is responsible for giving the goods and services.

G/L account: - for which g/l account the amount needs to be reflected.

Then after that the order will be released and it will be saved.

STEP 4: -

Here the purchase requisition will be raised by the following path: -

Here you can observe the material procurement category for the stock material it is reservation for an order and when it comes to the non-stock item it will be Preq for order.

Select the material and then after just click on the purchasing tab right above it. Here you can observe the details that you have mentioned.

Here the purchase requestion number will be generated, and this purchase requestion will be updated to the MM team or purchasing team which is present in the inventory.

STEP 5: -

Here the material purchase requestion will be converted into the purchase order by using the t-code ME21N. By using the purchase requestion documents overview we will just click on the purchase requestion and then click on the adopt or else we can just drag and drop the purchase requestion. 

We will just click on check and then after we will just save it.

STEP 6: -

After converting the purchase requestion into a purchase order then goods receipt will be done against the purchase order in the transaction code: - MIGO.It means the goods which are being procured from vendor needs to be updated right so we will just do goods reciept against the purchase order. 

Here the movement type will be 101 ‚Äì goods receipt against the purchase order and the checkbox needs to be checked. Then after click on the check and post. After clicking on post the materials will not be displayed in the inventory and those materials will directly send to the accounts.

Here the material is being procured and then after the invoice will be done based on PO.

STEP 7: -

The invoice will be raised against the purchase order and the invoice will be done in the transaction code: -MIRO.

Here the details of the purchase order will be picked up automatically. And the checkbox calculates tax needs to be checked, and the tax code needs to be entered in the po reference box and then the item ok checkbox too.

Enter the amount in the basic data tab and this is the amount that needs to be sent to the vendor.

Now after this we will just click on stimulate which is present in the application toolbar.

Now just click on save or post.

Note: - Steps 5, 6, 7 are mostly done by material management (MM) team.

STEP 8: -

Now just go back to your order and here just see the materials issued for the order by using the following path.

Now here the materials are being issued to the order.

STEP 9: -

After the materials are being procured and issued to the order the technician will perform the maintenance on the equipment and after performing the maintenance the confirmation will be done through t-code IW41.

STEP 10: -

After confirmation the technical confirmation will be done by going into the change mode of the order. TECO will clear all the material reservations that are being done for any other materials.

STEP11:-
Here after performing the technical confirmation the FICO team will perform the settlement for the order in KO88.Generally the settlement will be done at the end of the month.

Accounting document: -

Controlling documents: -

SUMMARY:-

When a non-stock material is required for a work order and is not available in inventory, a notification is created, and a maintenance order is generated in IW34 with the material entered as item category N along with purchasing details. Releasing the order creates a purchase requisition, which the MM team converts to a PO in ME21N. A goods receipt in MIGO (movement type 101) sends the material directly to the order without adding it to inventory. The vendor invoice is processed in MIRO, the maintenance is confirmed in IW41, the order is technically completed in IW32, and finally, the FICO team settles it in KO88.

The above describes the process of procuring the materials from external or vendor. Feel free to provide any comments or suggestions.

Regards ,
Neeraj

entry.title: Re: initial project stock upload 561Q is not reflected in...
entry.content:
561Q is used for initial entry into unrestricted project stock. It‚Äôs typically applied during initial data migration, such as during go-live or mergers/acquisitions. This movement adds stock to the project but does not consume budget or reflect in project line item reports, because it‚Äôs not considered a consumption or expense transaction.

Why it doesn‚Äôt reflect in Line Item or Budget is because, Project line item reports track actual costs posted to the project (WBS element or network). 561Q posts stock to inventory (Balance Sheet account), not to a cost object (Profit & Loss account). Since there‚Äôs no account assignment to a cost object, it doesn‚Äôt trigger budget consumption or appear in cost reports.

To ensure stock movements reflect in both project line item reports and budget consumption, consider:

Use Consumption Movement Types:

  • 221Q ‚Äì Consumption for project from project stock.
  • 261Q / 281Q ‚Äì Consumption for order or network from project stock.
  • These post to cost objects and consume budget.

Check Account Assignment:

  • Ensure materials are assigned to the correct WBS element or network.
  • Use movement types that trigger postings to P&L accounts.

Review whether the G/L accounts linked to movement types are correctly set up to post to cost objects. Use report RM07CUFA to reconcile field selections between G/L accounts and movement types

entry.title: Re: Why Clean Core matters - Get some insights into the about our brand new Extensibility Whitepaper
entry.content:
Hi ADR,

please send me an email with details and link to the document shared with partners. 
About naming the main idea behind was to avoid a kind of binary rating of clean core. For greenfield implementations it is still valid. Stay in level A. Break out in B if really needed (Tier2-Wrappers). Always Rethink if you really need the extension there. In best case always no!

in brownfield projects make a split between existing code and new code.

New code shall follow greenfield approach. In best case no extension and use more standard.

For existing code, make a retirement of unused code, leverage level A or B. Put C in observation mode, decouple and refactor for real company benefits.

Please contact your assigned partner manager to get updates and details. Visit Partner Edge Website for further information related to partner and certification process.

entry.title: SAP UX Q3/2025 Update ‚Äì Part 4: SAP SuccessFactors (AI, Joule and More)
entry.content:
This fourth post in my series gives an overview of user experience innovations in SAP SuccessFactors. It covers Joule and many AI-based UX innovations along with enhanced user experiences. By following the career of Jon, who starts by applying for a job and then grows within the company, you can see how our latest user experience innovations help business users (employees and managers), work more effectively.

Before reading this, do read the first blog post introducing the series and providing general information about Joule and central entry points and services, along with links to all the published parts of this blog post series:

  • SAP UX Q3/2025 Update ‚Äì Part 1: AI, Joule, SAP Build Work Zone, SAP Mobile Start.

Also, if you missed it, do have a look at the many UX innovations which already came out end of last year with the SAP SuccessFactors 2H2024 release:

  • SAP User Experience Q1/2025 Update ‚Äì Part 3: SAP SuccessFactors (AI, Joule and More).

The 1H2025 release comes with a large number of UX innovations across the whole portfolio. In the following sections, I‚Äôll summarize the main highlights by following the career of Jon, and showing how the new AI-powered UX innovations help:

  • Jon find the right job with the help of the new guided application experience.
  • Managers move through the hiring process more efficiently, rating skills and competencies of candidates with Joule, and getting AI-assisted interview insights.
  • Jon understand the main features available to him in his employee HR applications.
  • Jon get an easy-to-understand overview of his benefits and payroll.
  • Jon use natural language with Joule to get questions answered and detailed information about pay statements, not only from at his desk but also via mobile phone.
  • Jon learn more, with learning overview and skilled-based learning recommendations.
  • Jon and his manager to manage goals and performance reviews, with AI-insights making his manager‚Äôs job a lot easier.

One more innovation is the new alumni experience, for departing and departed employees, helping them to

  • Manage personal information and access important documents during and after the off-boarding process.

To get the complete picture of all the new SuccessFactors innovations, have a look at the links in the ‚ÄúFurther Information ‚Äú section towards the end of this post.

 

Find the Right Job With New Guided Application Experience

Jon is applying for a job at a company which uses SAP SuccessFactors Recruiting, and finds the whole process very intuitive, thanks to the new guided application experience, as well as the further enhancements in the reimagined candidate experience.

Figure 1 shows the new guided application experience. This attractive UI guides applicants through the required steps, with AI-assistance provided along the way. For example, Figure 1 shows the AI button ‚ÄúSuggest Skills‚Äù, which can help candidates when listing their own skills by indicating other skills which they may also have but did not consider mentioning.

Figure 1: Guided job application experience with SAP SuccessFactors Recruiting. Alt Text: A screenshot of a six-step guided activity, with the six steps running horizontally across the top of the screen: ‚ÄúGetting Started‚Äù, ‚ÄúProfile‚Äù, ‚ÄúSkills Information‚Äù, ‚ÄúEmployment‚Äù, ‚ÄúEducation‚Äù, ‚ÄúReview‚Äù. The screen shows ‚ÄúSkills Information‚Äù, with ten skills already selected, a search field for adding a skill and an AI ‚ÄúSuggest Skills‚Äù button.

Once Jon has gone through the guided steps, he can use the updated and refreshed applications dashboard that gives an overview of his applications with easy access to post-application steps, and to completed and in-progress applications. If Jon wants to review his candidate profile and make adjustments, this is also easier now with the refreshed candidate profile. See examples of these, and more, here:

  • Blog post: 1H 2025: Explore the Reimagined Candidate Experience and New AI-Assisted Capabilities in Recruiting.
  • Documentation: The Reimagined Candidate Experience.

 

Joule and AI-Assisted Interview Insights Help Managers Recruit

Providing Interview Feedback with Joule

Once the interview has taken place, each interviewer needs to summarize their feedback on the candidates, such as Jon. This can now be done easily using Joule and natural language, where you can say who you want to give feedback for and assing the ratings all in one go, as you can see in Figure 2.

Figure 2: Providing interview feedback with Joule. Alt Text: An image of Joule showing a chat, with the first entry by the user being ‚ÄúMike Wang‚Äù, followed by a text asking the user to provide feedback for him, explaining the scale 1 to 5 and providing a text for copying into the chat listing the five areas to rate, and a line for overall comment and one for recommendation. The user has copied the text into their response and added the ratings, comment and recommendation (‚Äúyes‚Äù). 

AI-Assisted Interview Insights

When multiple interviewers are involved, the recruiting manager needs to consolidate the feedback from all of them, based on their ratings of competencies as well as individual remarks. This is where the AI-assisted interview insights comes in handy: by clicking on the AI ‚Äúgenerate‚Äù button, the manager gets a natural language summary of the interviewer‚Äôs feedback on the candidate Jon. This is provided in sections Overview, Strengths, Concerns, Interviewer‚Äôs Overall Feedback, with a separate section Data Referenced that provides an overview of the inputs used to create the AI-assisted insights. Figure 3 shows an example, and Figure 4 shows it in action.

Not only does this help the manager save time and be more efficient, it also helps her be more effective: the feedback across multiple candidates is consolidated consistently, ensuring that all aspects of a candidate‚Äôs interview feedback are consolidated and uniformly presented. Furthermore, key insights are highlighted.

Figure 3: AI-assisted interview insights with SAP SuccessFactors Recruiting. Alt Text: A screenshot showing a pop-over with interview insights in natural langauge, in sections ‚ÄúOverview‚Äù, ‚ÄúStrengths‚Äù, ‚ÄúConcerns‚Äù, and ‚ÄúInterviewer‚Äôs Overall Feedback‚Äù. Bottom right has an AI button ‚ÄúRegenerate‚Äù and a button ‚ÄúClose‚Äù.

Figure 4: AI-assisted interview insights in action with SAP SuccessFactors Recruiting. Alt Text: A short video (GIF) showing a user press the AI button ‚ÄúGenerate‚Äù and showing the resulting insights, similar to what is shown in Figure 3.

Find out more:

  • 1H 2025: Revolutionizing Hiring Decisions with AI Interview Feedback Insights in SAP SF Recruiting.
  • Documentation: AI-Assisted Interview Feedback Insights.

 

Onboarding Made Easy with WalkMe

Jon got the job, and getting started is made easy for him with the onboarding checklist I featured in my February blog post. Now, when he starts using SAP SuccessFactors for the first time, to get some of his on-boarding tasks done, he gets built-in guidance via WalkMe, which explains applications step by step.

Figure 5 shows an example for when Jon opens up the Employee Profile, he gets an explanation about the purpose of the Profile Preview. Clicking on ‚ÄúNext‚Äù takes him to a brief explanation of the ‚ÄúSpotlight‚Äù.

Figure 5: An example of WalkMe providing guidance for SAP SuccessFactors users: first explaining the People Profile (upper image), then explaining the Spotlight (lower image). Alt Text: The upper image shows the People Profile for a user, with contact details on the left and cards for Skills, Competencies, Mentoring, Organization, About Me Video, Upcoming Absence on the right. A pop-over hovers above the list on the left with an explanation of the purpose of the People Profile and two buttons ‚ÄúNext‚Äù and greyed-out ‚ÄúBack‚Äù.

Easy-to-Understand Overview of Benefits and Payroll

Now that Jon is more familiar with SAP SuccessFactors, and has been on the job for a while, he‚Äôd like to get an overview of the various benefits he has enrolled in, along with details of his payroll, such as his pay statement along with pay related information. This is now easy with the enhanced People Profile in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central, which provides quick access to the various parts of your benefits (Figure 6) and payroll information (Figure 7). These pages list all the relevant parts, with direct links for more information on each of them.

Figure 7: Payroll information in the enhanced People Profile in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central. Alt Text: Screenshot of People Profile with the list of sections on the left, ‚ÄúPayroll‚Äù selected. On the right one card ‚ÄúPayroll‚Äù is shown, with a title ‚ÄúPayroll Information (1 of 3)‚Äù and a greyed out left-arrow button and a right-arrow button above a list of items and links.

Have a look at all the enhancements to People Profile in this video, or read about them in this blog post:

  • Video: 1H2025 release highlights ‚Äì people profile (32 seconds)
  • First Half 2025 Release: What‚Äôs New in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central?

Understand Pay Statements with Natural Language via Joule ‚Äì also Mobile

Jon has used Joule from his browser to answer various HR questions, as well as for creating leave requests. Now, he can use Joule on the go with the SAP SuccessFactors mobile app ‚Äì as I explained in my Part 1 blog post.

Jon had a look at his pay statement, via the enhanced People Profile we just talked about, and wasn‚Äôt quite sure whether he understood how it all fits together (something probably familiar to most people starting out in a job).  Fortunately, he can simply ask Joule to get a natural language explanation of the pay statement, as you can see in Figure 8.

Figure 8: Using Joule to explain your pay statement. Alt Text: An image of Joule showing a chat, with the first entry by the user being ‚ÄúExplain my pay‚Äù, followed by a text explaining the current month‚Äôs payslip in four sections ‚ÄúGross Pay‚Äù, ‚ÄúDeductions‚Äù, ‚ÄúNet Pay‚Äù and ‚ÄúEmployer Contributions‚Äù, and a reminder to check your payslip regularly to ensure tax code and other details are correct.

In figure 8, he simply asked ‚ÄúExplain my pay‚Äù and already got a concise summary  in natural language. He started asking ‚ÄúWhy are my deductions so high?‚Äù. If you want to see how Joule responds to that, and more, watch:

  • Video: 1H2025 release highlights ‚Äì explain my pay with Joule (35 seconds)

 

Learning Overview and Skill-Based Recommendations

Learning and Development in Enhanced People Profile

Jon is keen to progress in his career and learn more. The enhanced People Profile now includes a ‚ÄúLearning and Development‚Äù overview, as shown in Figure 9. Jon gets an overview of his development goals, assignments from the opportunity marketplace, learning history, and required learning, with links to more information and actions.

Figure 9: Learning and development information in the enhanced People Profile in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central. Alt Text: Screenshot of People Profile with the list of sections on the left, ‚ÄúLearning and Development‚Äù selected. On the right four cards are shown: Development Goals, Opportunity Marketplace Assignments, Learning History, Required Learning. Each has a list of items each with links, and a card-specific link at the bottom to go the application for the card‚Äôs topic.

Skill-Based Learning Recommendations

Based on Jon‚Äôs skills and his respective proficiency levels, Jon can now look at a particular skill in the Growth Portfolio which he would like to develop further, and get a learning recommendation from SAP SuccessFactors in the ‚ÄúOpportunities to Grow‚Äù section. Get a 30-second glimpse of this at 1:59 in this video:

  • Video: SAP SuccessFactors 1H 2025 Release Highlights.

 

Managing Goals and Performance Reviews

Towards the end of the year, it‚Äôs time for performance reviews and setting up goals for the next year. With the 1H2025 release, we are introducing a brand new user experience for doing this, with a new UI and several AI-assisted capabilities to help Jon and his manager get this done efficiently with good outcomes.

Figure 10 shows the new UI for managing performance, where you can see your goals, your skills, your ratings and your manager‚Äôs rating along with ratings from others.

Figure 10: The new performance form experience in SAP SuccessFactors Performance & Goals. Alt Text: Screenshot of the new form for performance, with the left two-thirds starting with a section for generating AI-powered insights, then ‚ÄúYour Goals‚Äù and ‚ÄúYour Skills‚Äù as lists with a slider for each entry depicting the rating, columns for employee rating, gap, weight and comment. The goal ‚ÄúIncrease sales by $100 million‚Äù has been selected. On the right details of the selected goal are shown, with sections ‚ÄúRating and Comment‚Äù, ‚ÄúRatings from Others‚Äù and ‚ÄúLinked Activity (2)‚Äù.

Jon‚Äôs manager finds it easier to craft helpful feedback by using the following new AI-assisted features:

  • AI-assisted comments, which uses the AI-writing assistant in order to help formulate comments.  (The AI writing assistant was first introduced a year ago, see my blog post from last summer).
  • AI-assisted feedback in performance reviews, which integrates rating context as well as user input to create recommendations for feedback texts.

To see the above in action, watch this:

  • Video: 1H 2025 release highlights - revamped performance form with AI (39 seconds).

Jon himself benefits from the new AI-based sentiment analysis for 360-degree reviews, shown in Figure 11. With this, he can quickly identify positive, negative or mixed feedback, as well as seeing which areas need improvement, thus aiding him in developing as a professional.

Figure 11: AI-based sentiment analysis for 360-degree reviews in SAP SuccessFactors Performance & Goals. Alt Text: A screenshot of the Detailed 360 Report in the background showing partly covered horizontal bar charts for ratings from Manager, Self, Direct Report/Peer/Other, All Except Self and All. The center contains a pop-over ‚ÄúCommunicating Effectively ‚Äì Comments‚Äù showing two anonymous comments, the first one labelled ‚Äúpositive‚Äù, the second one ‚Äúmixed‚Äù.

 To find out more about all the exciting innovations in SAP SuccessFactors Performance & Goals, including the ones just mentioned, look at this blog post:

  • First Half 2025 Release: What is New for SAP SuccessFactors Performance & Goals?

 

AI-Assisted Offboarding and New Alumni Experience

With this release, we provide AI-assistance to employees who are departing, via AI-assisted offboarding through Joule. This helps employees complete their tasks, providing them with a well-structured offboarding experience.

The new alumni experience goes one important step further, by giving ex-employees access to personal information, documents and resources ‚Äì and hence a much better overall user experience than before. Figure 12 shows the home page for alumni, giving them direct access to pay statements, profile, documents and personal information. They also get access to payroll and tax-related documents.

Figure 12: The new alumni home page in SAP SuccessFactors Onboarding. Alt Text: Image of the home page with a banner across the whole top with the text ‚ÄúGood Morning‚Äù , below that a section ‚ÄúQuick Action‚Äù with tiles for seven actions, such as ‚ÄúView My Pay Statement‚Äù, ‚ÄúView Company Documents‚Äù, and a section ‚ÄúOrganizational Updates‚Äù with four cards with news for alumni.

Get more information here:

  • Video: 1H 2025 release highlights - alumni experience (34 seconds).
  • 1H 2025: Alumni, AI-Assisted Offboarding & Mass Initiation in Onboarding.

 

Further Information on 1H2025 Release Highlights

These three assets give you an overview of the overall release highlights for 1H2025:

  • SAP SuccessFactors HCM 1H 2025 Release Highlights.
  • Video: SAP SuccessFactors 1H 2025 Release Highlights (3:24 min.)
  • Video: Business AI in SAP SuccessFactors ‚Äì 1H 2025 Release Highlights (3:43 min.).

These posts give details of innovations in the respective product areas:

  • What‚Äôs New in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central : 1H 2025
  • First Half 2025 Release: What's New in SAP SuccessFactors Learning?
  • First Half 2025: What‚Äôs New in SAP SuccessFactors HCM Mobile Application
  • What's New in SAP SuccessFactors Onboarding: 1H 2025
  • First Half 2025 Release: What is New for SAP SuccessFactors Performance & Goals?
  • What‚Äôs New in SAP SuccessFactors Recruiting : 1H 2025
  • First Half 2025 Release: What's New in SAP SuccessFactors Time Management

 

Continued soon‚Ä¶

I hope you enjoyed this third part, covering SAP SuccessFactors, with great new user experiences helping employees and managers work more efficiently and effectively.

Part four is coming soon, covering latest UX innovations in SAP Ariba and SAP Fieldglass, i.e. applications for managing your spend (procurement) and external workforce.

Part 1 of the series lists all the parts, and links to those parts that have already been published:

  • SAP UX Q3/2025 Update ‚Äì Part 1: AI, Joule, SAP Build Work Zone, SAP Mobile Start.

Do keep posting your experiences and recommendations yourself in the SAP Community, with the SAP Fiori and/or the User Experience tag! In case you are wondering how to get a list of the most recent blog posts on SAP Fiori and User Experience in our new SAP Community, use these links:

  • Latest blog posts on SAP Fiori in the SAP Community.
  • Latest blog posts on User Experience in the SAP Community.

entry.title: Re: Missing Create external document(URL) button in GOS o...
entry.content:
Hi @nagao_masahiro_ 

Thank you for your message.

Please note, the ‚ÄúCreate external document‚Äù button in the Generic Object Services panel for ME21N is not available in SAP S/4HANA Cloud 2508, while it does exist in the on-premise edition. The primary reason is that SAP S/4HANA Cloud limits certain legacy functionalities like GOS attachment features. It focuses instead on standard cloud-based document management via the Attachment Service and the Manage Documents Fiori app.

Here are points to understand:

Please note, S/4HANA Cloud has stricter security, standardization, and reduced customisation. Compared to On-Premise, this includes limited or reimagined GOS features.

For external documents and URLs, as a Cloud edition user, ensure you use the Manage Documents app or other supported document management tools, not GOS.

The SAP cloud product roadmap may bring more features, but legacy options available on-premise are often replaced or omitted in the Cloud due to architectural differences and focus on newer Fiori solutions.

If you specifically need to attach a URL, you have the possibility to investigate cloud-native options via Attachment Service or request an SAP enhancement for your business process.

I hope this provides the necessary information. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: production order Work in progress settlement is not r...
entry.content:
If your system is already set up for Settlement, follow the below steps

If you are not sure on this, follow the below steps

Periodic Settlement to WBS

This transfers actual costs (including WIP if configured) from the production order to the WBS element. It ensures that your project reflects the incurred costs even before the order is fully settled.

Final Settlement to Material

Once the production order is technically complete or fully delivered, you do a final settlement. This moves the costs from the WBS to the inventory (material), completing the cost flow.

entry.title: Re: Autosubmission of empty timesheets
entry.content:
Hi @Chris1973 

Thanks for the response, again. As I mentioned I have tried to explicit define the logic in the rule to submit timesheets with no manual entries, no imported entries, no generated entries and no absences. However, this does not pick up any empty timesheets. As I previously mentioned, it seems when the timesheet is untouched no external code is generated and the timesheet is not picked up in the job, this si the root cause. Do you think this can be logged as a bug?

entry.title: Re: impossible to add document for virtual assets and non...
entry.content:
Hi @Joo_Leo 

Thank you for your question. Let me walk you through possible scenarios.

The reason you are facing the issue lies in the fact that, in SAP Business One, you cannot mix virtual assets and regular items or non-virtual assets in the same document. SAP explicitly blocks this to ensure correct asset capitalization and inventory management.

You have the possibility to resolve the issue by creating separate purchase orders. One for virtual assets and another for regular inventory items or non-virtual assets

Please ensure to review your purchase order. If it includes both types of items, split them into different documents as required. If you are unsure which items are classified as virtual assets, I suggest you check the asset settings or consult asset master data for items marked with the virtual asset flag.

If this error still persists for items you believe are not virtual assets, please ensure to review their definitions and ensure proper field setup per SAP guidelines.

I hope this provides the necessary information. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: ABAP Extensibility Guide ‚Äì Clean Core for SAP S/4HANA Cloud - August 2025 Update
entry.content:
Hi Community,

"

  • Level B can be achieved by custom extensions that comply with SAP recommendations for the use of classic ABAP development technologies and the frameworks offered as classic SAP APIs
  • Level C contains custom extensions which cannot be qualified for Level B because of usage of arbitrary SAP internal objects. Under the condition that dedicated checks are performed before the release upgrade (following the changelog for SAP objects approach), these custom extensions can be considered conditionally clean.
  • Level D is not clean core and includes custom extensions with severe violations of SAP development recommendations like modifications, usage of not recommended SAP objects or extension technologies (e.g. implicit enhancements)."

Thanks for your sharing, it really help us great a lot.

Regards,
